author: Special Correspondent
text:
Curious to learn about the courses ranging from engineering to medicine, around 520 higher secondary students assembled at SBOA Matriculation Higher Secondary School auditorium.

The event was organised jointly by The Hindu in School and Gitam University.

Prof. K. Vijaya Bhaskar Raju, Director, Gitam School of Technology, Bengaluru cleared a few misconceptions among students about engineering and other courses. Students were advised to take their own decision on choice of courses, institutions, and not go by peer pressure or parental influence, which may affect their career in future

He said that it is easy to get a seat for B.E., than commerce stream.

The director said reputed institutions play a vital role in securing a prominent placement.

He quoted that students seeking admission in institutions must ensure that it has good infrastructure, lab facilities and qualified faculties.

He also insisted that before getting admission the students must visit the campus and see the facilities.

Students insist on joining reputed institutions even if they don’t get the course of their choice, but they still excel in their chosen course, Prof. Raju said quoting a few examples.

He explained the salient and cutting edge features of Gitam University, Bengaluru.

Since communication plays an important role in spite of excelling in academics, people failed to secure a good placement due to lack of communication skill for which he said Gitam has a specialised English language lab for improving language and communication skills.
title: Career counselling for students
